Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Here is the maths challenge.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: If we start on Dec 21st with KMD at 76k sats and you held 10k KMD, if you had 1 BTC, how much would you need to long to retain the same amount of KMD but also make back the same amount of BTC lost during the bear market factoring open interest üòõ

Author: Malti#3948
Content: @Cryptoon is also not retarded when it comes to numbers

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Easy answer would be 7.6BTC on that day, current price = 1.3BTC so needed to make 6.3BTC

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Actually maybe my question does not work, you couldnt have longed and made money üòõ

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: The reason for this exercise is to figure out if there is a optimal strategy of using BTC longs to offset losses incurred during BTC bull runs where alts get killed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is not a maths problem, more a trading strategy issue

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: you couldnt have longed kmd/btc to gain more btc as kmd/btc is at atl

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: kmd/usd to gain more btc yes, but that is not taking into account the btc/usd gain you had in the same period

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: kmd/usd gained less %wise than btc/usd

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: @jl777c you are right
